message: I am an expert in this topic.
It's gin + sloe berries soaked in it - apparently a traditional British thing. Plymouth makes one that's available here that's pretty good. It's pretty pure red - an amazing color.

So, a friend was over tonight who really likes sweet drinks - daiquiris and crap like that. I made her a sloe gin fizz - with real sloe gin! - and she freaking loved it. I got the recipe from Boozehound, which is an amazingly stellar book, if you haven't read it already. Lots of great recipes and wonderful, wonderful stories about the liquor in there. There's this huge revolution in cocktail-making these days that's been attributed to a lot of new liquors being available in the States for the first time since Prohibition. Really great stuff going on.
Kind of a sour thing, but mixed with simple syrup and and lemon juice and club soda it tastes like liquid jelly beans.
I once ordered a "Medoyeff and soda" - Medoyeff being the vodka made by House Distilleries, an amazing local company - and they thought I said "Midori." So, I got to drink a Midori and club soda.
it was, surprisingly, not the worst thing I've ever had.
Never heard of sloe gin before.
Hah, that's funny, it reminds me...I knew someone in college who used to always order Midori Sour, and wow that was a sweet drink, but she loved it.
Also: holy shit, can I just say that I use my soda stream every damn day and that it's the best thing that's ever happened to my kitchen.
I just finished a bottle of ROOT liquor -- if the marketing is to be believed it's the alcoholic predecessor of rootbeer. Pretty good.
i've always wondered what an alcoholic version of root beer would taste like
It really does taste a lot like highly alcoholic root beer! http://www.artintheage.com/spirits/about/
I usually mixed it with creme soda or "real" root beer since it's a liquor and I don't usually like those straight; such combinations are definitely like an alcoholic rootbeer soda.
also, it's not 'random' but carpano antiquea can make anything AMAZING.
portland oregon and sloe gin fizz, if that ain't love, then tell me what is
